description: This file implements the core functions for an HTTP Web Client Transaction object, handling query, receive, send, finish, and abort operations within an HTTP transaction lifecycle.

classes.name: PHTTP_WEBC_TRANS_OBJECT
classes.description: Structure representing the HTTP web client transaction object, managing the transaction state and associated interfaces.

classes.name: PHTTP_BMO_REP_OBJECT
classes.description: Represents the HTTP reply message object, providing methods to examine message state and process payloads.

classes.name: PHTTP_BMO_REQ_OBJECT
classes.description: Represents the HTTP request message object, handling request headers, bodies, and output functions.

methods.name: ULONG HttpWctoQuery(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,PVOID buffer,ULONG ulSize,ANSC_HANDLE hBufferContext)
methods.description: Determines the processing mode (collect or process) based on the current message state and incoming data buffer.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpWctoRecv(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,PVOID buffer,ULONG ulSize,ANSC_HANDLE hBufferContext)
methods.description: Processes incoming payload data, delegating examination and processing of message content to associated objects.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpWctoSend(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hMessage,ULONG ulSendFlags)
methods.description: Handles the sending of an HTTP message, specifically headers and body, through the associated TCP client.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpWctoFinish(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,PVOID buffer,ULONG ulSize,ANSC_HANDLE hBufferContext)
methods.description: Finalizes the transaction when the client indicates no more data will be sent, closing resources if the message is complete.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpWctoAbort(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ULONG ulEvent)
methods.description: Handles transaction aborts due to network failures or other critical events, notifying the appropriate interface.
